titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Pamela Schafler Graphic Collection
1930s, 1960s
PR 331

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-07-10T11:06-0400

did.abstract: This collection consists of material donated by Pamela Schafler. It includes correspondence and telephotographs, with a total of 7 items.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as:Pamela Schafler graphic collection, PR 331, Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org. Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to:
Department of Rights and Reproductions The New-York Historical Society 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194 rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org 212-485-9228

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of material donated by Pamela Schafler, chair of the New-York Historical Society's Board of Trustees. It includes two pieces of correspondence from Jacqueline Kennedy, a photograph of President John F. Kennedy, a photograph of President Lyndon Johnson and family, and an envelope from the White House postmarked 1964. In addition, there are two telephotographs (photographs transmitted via telegraph, a process also know as phototelegraphy) from the 1930s. The telephotographs are stamped "This telephotograph was transmitted over wires of the Bell System."
